mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Graham, John, 1774-1820
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Discusses business matters; letter to French minister shown to Mr. Rush who has done what Monroe promised minister. Mr. de'Newville's letter left with Rush, copies will be sent to Mr. Lee; will write tomorrow to Mr. Jones, Consul at Tripoli; received letter from Mr. Shaler, all quiet in Algiers, speaks of Treaty renewal. Glad Monroe's health improved. Autograph Letter Signed.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: Jay Johns Collection of James Monroe Papers
mdRecord.dcterms:title: John Graham, Dept. of State, to James Monroe, 1816 September 27
